meanings.definition: A unit of land measurement in Colombia, equivalent to approximately 0.973 acres.
meanings.sent1: The farmer owned a large plot of land, measuring several fanegadas.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent estimated the farm to be around ten fanegadas in size.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as everyone wanted to buy the fanegadas of land near the river.
meanings.sent4: In the distance, the vast fanegadas of green fields stretched out like a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent5: The old map showed the boundaries of the fanegadas clearly marked with dotted lines.

meanings.definition: The act of measuring land using the fanegada unit.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor's job involved calculating fanegadas for the new construction project.
meanings.sent2: The accuracy of the land survey depended on the precise fanegadas measurement.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending to be surveyors measuring fanegadas in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous fanegadas counting ensured the land division was fair to all parties.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map depicted the process of fanegadas measurement with detailed illustrations.

meanings.definition: A specific area of land measured in fanegadas.
meanings.sent1: The inheritance included several fanegadas of fertile soil passed down for generations.
meanings.sent2: The farmer proudly showed off his well-tended fanegadas of land to visitors.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors admired the beautiful flowers blooming on the fanegadas next door.
meanings.sent4: The auction winner celebrated acquiring the prime fanegadas at a bargain price.
meanings.sent5: The landscape painter captured the essence of the fanegadas in a stunning masterpiece.
